EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation). 

This Order provides for the commencement of Part 4 of the Family Leave and 
Miscellaneous Provisions Act 2021 (the “Act”) with effect from 1 April 2021. 

The purpose of the Act is, inter alia, to provide for an extension of the entitlement 
to Parent’s Leave and Benefit for each qualifying parent from 2 weeks to 5 
weeks, to extend the period in which Parent’s Leave and Benefit can be taken to 
not later than two years after the birth or adoptive placement of the child; to 
provide for Adoptive Leave and Benefit for male same sex couples (with 
consequential amendments to Paternity Leave and Benefit and Parent’s Leave 
and Benefit) and to enable adoptive couples to choose which parent may avail 
of Adoptive Leave. 

 Part 4 of the Act amends the Adoptive Benefit, Paternity Benefit, and Parent’s 
Benefit provisions in the Social Welfare (Consolidation) Act 2005 (as amended).
